newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: POLL-Bank/Portugal seen leaving rates steady.
newsitem.headline: POLL-Bank/Portugal seen leaving rates steady.

text.p: Eight out of 10 analysts polled by Reuters said the Bank of Portugal was expected to leave its key repo rate steady on Friday at the start of a new commercial bank reserve accounting period.
Nine out of the 10 analysts said they expected the central bank to leave the absorption rate, used to drain funds from the money market, unchanged.
All the analysts said they believed the Bank of Portugal had room to ease rates in the medium term.
The repo rate is currently 6.00 percent, the draining rate 5.70 percent and the emergency lending rate 7.70 percent.
The Bank of Portugal will announce its decision on rates at 1315 GMT on Friday.
The following are the results of the poll, conducted today:
1. Will the Bank of Portugal cut the repo rate this week?
Yes - 2
2. If the answer to question 1. is yes, by how much will the Bank of Portugal cut the repo rate?
10 to 20 basis points
3. Will the Bank of Portugal cut the absorption rate this week?
No - 9
Yes - 1
4. If the answer to question 3. is yes, by how much will the Bank of Portugal cut the absorption rate?
20 basis points
5. Does the Bank of Portugal have room to cut rates further?
No - 0
Yes - 10

NOTE: The following groups have agreed to be identified as participants in the poll: Banco Finantia; Banco Portugues de Investimento; Banco Mello de Investimentos; IMF-Informacao de Mercados Financeiros; Siemca-Sociedade Mediadora de Capitais; Fincor; Banco Essi; Credit Lyonnais.
